name: Mallard
tagline: Data Acquisition for the CRIS experiment at ISOLDE
body:
### Mallard for CRIS at [ISOLDE](http://isolde.web.cern.ch/)
Mallard is data acquisition software for the Collinear Resonant Ionization Spectroscopy experiment at CERN.

### Installation
Mallard is written in python and so requires a python distribution such as [Anaconda](https://store.continuum.io/).
#### Dependences
Mallard has the following dependencies:
* [wxPython](http://www.wxpython.org/)
* [SciPy](http://www.scipy.org/) (on windows we use [Anaconda](https://store.continuum.io/) )
* [PyDAQmx](http://pythonhosted.org/PyDAQmx/)

Mallard also uses [NI-DAQmx](http://www.ni.com/dataacquisition/nidaqmx.htm) from National Instruments to interface the **USB-6211** card.

### Development
The mallard package uses several sub-packages:
* `mallard.core` - base functionality for the package including data and file handling, as well as managing a general capture session including settings
* `mallard.daq` - interfaces to the USB-6211 card. If the card needs changed in future then only this module needs rewritten
* `mallard.gui` - provides the user interface using wxPython
* `mallard.test` - all the small scripts created along the way, in case they come in handy at a later point

### Authors
Originally written by Kieran Campbell (@kieranrcampbell) as part of the CERN summer student program.
